description: Calm the model. For mechanical processes, all linear and rotational velocities are set to 0. This is useful for removing kinetic energy from the system and preparing for a new loading stage or when transitioning between different simulation phases.
notes: Sets all rotational velocities (angular velocities/spin) to 0
Applies to all pieces: balls, clumps, and walls
Does not affect positions or forces
Useful for removing kinetic energy from system
Often used when transitioning between loading stages
Commonly used before changing boundary conditions or applying new loads
Does not reset stress or strain history

examples.description: Set all velocities (linear and rotational) to zero

examples.command:
model cycle 1000
model calm
model cycle 2000
examples.description: Run cycles, calm velocities, then continue cycling

examples.command:
model solve
model calm
wall attribute velocity-y -0.1 range id 1
examples.description: Solve to equilibrium, calm system, then apply new boundary velocity
Calm followed by explicit velocity assignment (calm is simpler for zeroing)

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model calm') - Python SDK does not provide direct calm method
